Line 19: Line 19:
The Linux model of the Acer [[Acer Aspire|Aspire]] one became available in July 2008, while the more expensive Windows XP version arrived in the US Stores in August 2008. The Aspire One was initially available in white and blue, with a 3-cell battery. Acer is expected to introduce models later with the larger 6-cell battery, as well as a wider selection of colors.
The Linux model of the Acer [[Acer Aspire|Aspire]] one became available in July 2008, while the more expensive Windows XP version arrived in the US Stores in August 2008. The Aspire One was initially available in white and blue, with a 3-cell battery. Acer is expected to introduce models later with the larger 6-cell battery, as well as a wider selection of colors.
â
Acer and its Taiwanese partner Linpus equipped the Linux version with a simplified user interface, with default applications like the Firefox 2 browser and [[OpenOffice]] 2.3 programs like Writer directly available in fixed windows on the default screen.
+
Acer and its Taiwanese partner Linpus equipped the Linux version with a simplified user interface, with default applications like the [[Mozilla Firefox|Firefox]] 2 browser and [[OpenOffice]] 2.3 programs like Writer directly available in fixed windows on the default screen.
